profile-background"><div class="row profile-layout"><div class="col-md-12"><p>This is the Privacy Policy of The View B.V. (hereinafter referred to as "The View," "we," "us" or "our"). Our Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, share and protect personal information as well as your related choices regarding use, access, and correction when you visit our website located at https://jointheview.com/ (Website). We process personal data in a manner that is in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (in Dutch: Algemene Verordening Gegevensbescherming). We may update this policy from time to time by publishing a new version on our Website.</p><p>Responsible for data processing</p><p>The View B.V. is responsible for the processing of your personal data with respect to the use of our website as shown in this Privacy Policy.</p><p>Contact details:<br> The View B.V.<br> Piet Heinkade 55<br> 1019 GM, Amsterdam<br> The Netherlands<br> Registered in the Trade Register of the Netherlands Chamber of Commerce: 81938683</p><p>To exercise your rights or for any questions regarding the use, collection or processing of your personal information, please contact us via: privacy@jointheview.com</p><p>What kind of information do we collect?</p><p>When you visit our Website, you are visiting The Views corporate website. We operate several websites, mobile applications and other services associated with The Views businesses and products. Each of these properties and services you may choose to visit has privacy policies that differ from this Privacy Policy due to the nature of those propertiesandservices. ThisPrivacyPolicydoesnotapplytotheseotherwebsites,mobile applications or services operated by The View, such as The View VR app available in the Meta Quest Store.</p><p>The Website is intended for a general audience, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of 16.</p><p>Through this Website we only collect the following personal information:<br> - Email address and language preference you choose to give for the newsletter;</p><div title="Page 2"><div><div><div><p>Effective Date as of October 2022</p><ul><li><p>Personal details you choose to give when corresponding with us by phone, email or other communication methods between you and The View, including through our "Contact Us" feature;</p></li><li><p>Technical information about your device, browser settings, geo-location, preferences or online activity, collected via cookies or similar technologies when you visit our Website. For more information, see our Cookies Policy;</p></li><li><p>How do we use this information?</p></li><li><p>Your personal data will be processed by us only for the following purposes:</p></li><li><p>To provide our services and products to you</p></li><li><p>We may use your name and contact details to communicate with you by email, phone, or other communication methods for the provision of our services and products.</p></li><li><p>Marketing</p></li><li><p>We may use your information to contact you with newsletters, advertisements or other information about our services and products that may be of interest to you. We may use your email and language preference to send you emails with personalised advertisements and special offers in your preferred language.</p></li><li><p>We do this only if you have explicitly given your consent to us to do so or if you have requested us to send you this information. You may unsubscribe from our e-mails to which you have subscribed at any time by clicking on the unsubscribe link in the e-mail. You may always contact us to unsubscribe from receiving messages containing advertisements and offers.</p></li><li><p>Log file information</p></li><li><p>We also gather information by the use of cookies and other similar technologies. We use strictly necessary cookies and similar technologies to operate our Website and to provide you with the requested service. We may also use cookies for a more personalized user experience, for example by remembering your preferred language settings. By means of cookies we can also see how you use our website, allow us to learn about your visit and how we can make the website more user-friendly. We will not place cookies that are not strictly necessary for the provision of our website and services, unless you have given us your consent for these cookies when you first visit our website. Find out more about the cookies we use in our Cookie Policy.</p></li><li><p>Communications and support</p></li><li><p>We use your contact details to communicate with you about our services and in order to reply to questions or to handle complaints about our services and products through our "Contact Us" feature or other communication methods.</p></li></ul></div></div></div></div><div title="Page 3"><div><div><div><p>When you have applied for a job</p><p>We use your personal data to process your application in case you have applied for a job at The View. Among others, the following data are processed: first name, last name, gender, date of birth, address, zip code, place of residence, telephone number, email address, educational level, availability, resume and motivation.</p><p>Fraud prevention and detection</p><p>We may process your personal in case we believe this is necessary for the purpose of fraud prevention and detection, for example in case we have reason to believe that unauthorized access to your account has taken place or if we have reason to be believe that your account is used or otherwise involved in fraudulent activities. In such we may also process your personal data where this is necessary for the purpose of resolving security incidents, to protect and secure your data or to communicate with you in such case.</p><p>To improve our services</p><p>We may analyse your data in aggregated or pseudonomized form to improve our services to you and for determining our (general) strategy.</p><p>Lawful grounds</p><p>We only process your personal data based on lawful grounds such as your consent (for example when we place performance or marketing cookies, or to be able to send you our newsletters or marketing communications), for the execution of our agreement with you (as mentioned above) or when this is necessary for the protection of our legitimate interests, unless your interests, fundamental rights or freedoms outweigh these interests. In determining whether processing can take place on the basis of our legitimate interests, a prior balancing of interests will be made between the interests of The View (or group companies of The View) and the interests of the data-subjects involved. Processing for the purpose of analyzing, maintaining and optimizing our (mobile) websites, apps and related technologies and for the purpose of fraud detection or prevention can for example (when a prior and careful balancing of interests in favor of the business interests) take place on this legal basis. We also conduct market research and compile management information for product and service development, to improve our services and for determining our (general) strategy.</p><p>How is your data shared?</p><p>We will not share your data with third parties unless with your prior permission or if one of the following situations apply:</p></div></div></div></div><div title="Page 4"><div><div><div><ul><li><p>- We may disclose your data with our parent company or other group companies in so far as reasonably necessary for the purposes set out above (under How do we use your information);</p></li><li><p>- We may disclose your data to third party service providers that we engage in the performance of our services (Service Providers), such as hosting parties, e-mail providers, software providers, platforms that we use to manage our newsletters and marketing communications and other Service Providers that we use to be able to provide you with high quality services in the best possible way. Insofar as these third parties process personal data in the performance of their services, they do so in the role of processors of The View or group companies of The View . All our processors are obliged to protect your personal data. We conclude agreements with our processors in which we explicitly include this.</p><p>In special cases, we may make personal data available to third parties without your consent. Special cases include legitimate requests to do so from authorities, subpoenas or court orders, actions to detect or prevent damage or fraud, or actions to ensure the security of our network and services.</p><p>Thid Party Services</p><p>Some of the Service Providers that may access your data are mentioned below.</p><p>Google Analytics<br> Like most websites, this we use Google Analytics 4 (GA) to track user interaction. We use this data to determine the number of people using our site, to better understand how they find and use our web pages and to see their journey through the website. Although GA records data such as your geographical location, device, internet browser and operating system, none of this information personally identifies you to us. GA also records your computers IP address which could be used to personally identify you but Google does not grant us access to this. Google may also transfer this information to third parties where required to do so by law or where such third parties process this data on Googles behalf.</p><p>More information about the Google Analytics cookies that are used on our Website can be found in our Cookies Policy. The privacy policy of Google can be found here [insert URL].</p></li></ul></div></div></div></div><div title="Page 5"><div><div><div><p>Amazon Web Services</p><p>We use the cloud infrastructure of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to cloud-host and maintain the database and web content. Therefore, customer data may flow through or be stored within this system. AWS infrastructure is housed in high-security controlled environments pursuant to the AWS Cloud Security policy https://aws.amazon.com/security/. You can find more information on AWS and data protection at https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/eudata-protection/ and at https://aws.amazon.com/privacy/ .</p><p>Change of control</p><p>If we sell or otherwise transfer part or the whole of our company or our assets to another organization (e.g., in the course of a transaction like a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy, dissolution, liquidation), your information may be among the items sold or transferred. The buyer or transferee will have to honour the commitments we have made in this Privacy Policy.</p><p>Safety and security</p><p>We have taken appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure that the regulations and requirements relating to data protection are observed and upheld both by ourselves and by our external service providers. We use the latest technologies to protect your information against loss or unlawful processing. We use safeguards to help keep the information collected through the Website secure; encryption of sending personal data via our website (SSL) and regularly updating our systems are examples of these measures. However, we cannot ensure the security of any information you transmit to us or guarantee that information on the website may not be accessed, disclosed, altered, or destroyed. We request you to do your part to help us. You are responsible for maintaining the secrecy of your unique password and account information, and for controlling access to emails between you and us, at all times. We are not responsible for the functionality, privacy, or security measures of any other organization.</p><p>If you think that your data is not properly secured or if you have indications that your data is being misused, please send us an email to: [include e-mail address].</p><p>International transfer</p><p>Your personal data may be transferred to and maintained on computers located outside the European Economic Area (EEA) that may not have data protection rules that require the same level of protection. However, in the case we engage non-European service providers, we carefully consider whether an adequate level of protection can be provided. These service providers are only permitted to use the information insofar as reasonably necessary for the performance of the agreement you have concluded with us. Where necessary, we conclude data transfer agreements with these service providers based on standard contractual clauses established by the European Commission. These service providers may be obliged to provide access to your data based on their applicable laws and regulations. For more information about safeguards for international transfers, please contact us using the contact details provided in this Privacy Policy.</p></div></div></div></div><div title="Page 6"><div><div><div><p>Retention period</p><p>In accordance with the law, we do not retain your personal data any longer than is reasonably necessary for attaining the purposes for which they were collected outlined in this Privacy Policy, or for the duration required by any legal, regulatory, accounting or reporting requirements, whichever is the longer. We will retain your personal data as follows:</p></div></div><table><tbody><tr><td><div><div><p>Type of personal data</p></div></div></td><td><div><div><p>Retention period</p></div></div></td></tr><tr><td><div><div><p>Correspondence</p></div></div></td><td><div><div><p>Up to 5 years after the last transaction due to the statutory limitation period for claims for damages. This information may serve as evidence.</p></div></div></td></tr><tr><td><div><div><p>Marketing communications (email address)</p></div></div></td><td><div><div><p>Until you unsubscribe. If you decide that you no longer wish to receive the marketing communications, we will keep the withdrawal of your request. You may unsubscribe from our advertisements, offers at any time.</p></div></div></td></tr><tr><td><div><div><p>Job application data</p></div></div></td><td><div><div><p>The data provided by you including resume and motivation will be kept by us for a period of four months from the moment you apply for a job with us. If you have given your permission to keep your data for future job opportunities, your data will be deleted after one year. In case you are hired for employment at The View, your data will be part of your personnel file and kept for up to two years after leaving the employment.</p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table><div><div><p>Upon expiry of the applicable retention period, we will securely destroy your personal data in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. In some circumstances we may anonymize your personal data so that it can no longer be associated with you, in which case it is no longer personal data.</p></div></div><div><div><p><br> If you would like details of the retention periods for a particular aspect of your personal information which is not detailed above, please contact us at privacy@jointheview.com.</p></div></div></div></div><div title="Page 7"><div><div><div><p>You have the statutory right to know what personal data of yours we have stored and to whom we have disclosed it. You are entitled to request information at no cost about your data at any time and without charge, and to demand its correction, deletion or blocking. You may also revoke your consent to the processing methods at any time with immediate effect for the future.</p><p>You can easily access most of your data (including the data provided by you) and rectify/correct such data though your registered account. If you have created an account on our website as a customer, you can delete your account by sending us an email to remove your account.</p><p>If you have created an account on Success Factorys website, you can either send Success Factory or us an email to deactivate your account. We will anonymise your personal information, in which case it is no longer considered personal information.</p><p>If you wish, we can send your personal data to you so that you can transfer it to another party. You can make a request to that effect by sending an email to us. Most likely, in such case we will no longer be able to continue our service as we can no longer guarantee the safeguard of your personal data.</p><p>In addition, you can ask us to restrict the processing of your personal data (for example if you deem the information to be incorrect, the processing is unnecessary or the processing is unlawful) or the termination of use of your personal information.</p><p>We do not use automated decision-making without human intervention, including profiling, in a way that produces legal effects concerning you or that otherwise significantly affects you.</p><p>Remember, you can always object to the processing of your personal data.</p><p>If you would like further information about how your personal information is stored, or you wish to exercise one of your aforementioned rights, please send us an email. You may be contacted by our customer support team in order to verify your identity before we fulfil your request. This is to protect your privacy. Finally, you can always submit a complaint about our data processing practices to the Dutch Data Protection Authority via www.autoriteitpersoonsgegevens.nl</p></div></div></div></div><div title="Page 8"><div><div><div><p>Children's privacy</p><p>We do not intend to address to children (under 13 in the US, under 16 for EU residents, or other age as required by local law) ("Children"). We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from Children. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your Children has provided us with personal information, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected personal information from a child under the age of 16 (or the applicable age in their territory) without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information from our servers.</p><p>Changes to this privacy policy</p><p>We may modify or update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.</p><p>How to contact us</p><p>If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy of the Service, please send an email privacy@ jointheview.com.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></main><footer class="footer"><div class="footer__container"><ul class="footer__media_links"><li
